main event: Multiple metallic, highly polished, and sun-reflecting UFOs were observed over Somerset, Pennsylvania on July 19, 1954, for a duration of 45 minutes, moving at high speeds and displaying unusual flight patterns.
interesting points: The objects were observed by four adult witnesses, two men, and two women, who all saw the objects and are willing to make statements.
The UFOs were approximately 40 to 140 ft in diameter and traveled at a speed of approximately 1,000 miles per hour at an altitude of about 12,000 to 15,000 feet.
They appeared to be highly polished and reflective, reflecting the sun's rays as they moved in diagonal paths, changed direction, circled, and darted about before disappearing from view.
The witnesses are described as intelligent and reliable persons, not given to excitable behavior or imagination. Similar sightings had been reported in the area in the past.
The writer of the report had seen similar objects on several occasions and forwarded the report in the hope of an official recognition or investigation by the U.S. Air Force.
sighted object: Multiple metallic, highly polished, and sun-reflecting UFOs
